title: How to Make a Photo Collage on iPhone: Complete Guide

steps.title: Open the Google Photos app.
steps.content: Open the Google Photos app. If you don't already have this app, you can download it for free from the App Store . Log into your Google account if you aren't already logged in.

steps.title: Upload your photos.
steps.content: Upload your photos. If you don't already have photos uploaded to Google Photos, tap + and select Album . Tap Select photos to upload from your Camera Roll. [1] X Research source You must allow permission for Google Photos to access your camera roll.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This is in the top-right corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Collage.
steps.content: Tap Collage . This is the second option.

steps.title: Select up to 6 photos.
steps.content: Select up to 6 photos. You can use 1 to 6 photos in your collage.

steps.title: Tap Create.
steps.content: Tap Create . Your collage will be created.

steps.title: Edit the collage.
steps.content: Edit the collage. You can replace, edit, rotate, or reposition any photo in the collage. To replace a photo, tap it. Select Replace , select a new photo, and select Done . To edit a photo, tap the photo and select Edit . To rotate a photo, tap and hold the photo. Turn the photo to rotate it as needed. To zoom in or out of a photo, pinch closed or pinch open. To change the order of a photo, tap and hold the photo. Then, drag it to a new location.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This will save the collage to your Google Photos. To share the collage, select it, and then tap the Share button.

steps.title: Open the Shortcuts app.
steps.content: Open the Shortcuts app. This app comes preinstalled on your iPhone. If you don't have it, you'll need to redownload it from the App Store.

steps.title: Create a new Shortcut.
steps.content: Create a new Shortcut. To do this, tap the + at the top-right corner to open the New Shortcut menu. Then, you'll want to rename the shortcut using these steps: Tap the current name at the top. Select Rename . Enter a name for your shortcut, like "Merge Photos" or "Make a Collage". Tap Done to save your new Shortcut.

steps.title: Tap + Add Action.
steps.content: Tap + Add Action . This is the blue button near the top. The bottom menu will expand.

steps.title: Add the "Select Photos" action to your Shortcut.
steps.content: Add the "Select Photos" action to your Shortcut. This action allows you to choose photos to add to your college. Here's what you'll need to do: Search "photos" and scroll down to the list of shortcuts relating to photos. Tap Select Photos under the Media header. This action will be added as the first step of the shortcut.

steps.title: Tap the arrow next to "Select photos".
steps.content: Tap the arrow next to "Select photos". The options will expand.

steps.title: Toggle on "Select Multiple".
steps.content: Toggle on "Select Multiple". The switch will turn green.

steps.title: Add the "Combine Images" action.
steps.content: Add the "Combine Images" action. Here's how: Tap the search bar at the bottom. The bottom menu will expand again. Search "image" and scroll down to the list of shortcuts containing the word "image." Tap Combine Images . This will be under the Media header. This action will be added as the next step of the shortcut. By default, this will combine images horizontally. To change this, tap the arrow next to Horizontally and select Vertically or In a Grid .

steps.title: Add the "Save to Photo Album" action.
steps.content: Add the "Save to Photo Album" action. This is the last action you'll be adding to your Shortcut. Tap the search bar at the bottom. The bottom menu will expand again. Search "photos" and scroll down to the list of shortcuts relating to photos. Tap Save to Photo Album under the Media header. This action will be added as the third and final step of the shortcut.

steps.title: Add your collage Shortcut to the share sheet.
steps.content: Add your collage Shortcut to the share sheet. This will make it easy to find your shortcut when you share photos from the Photos app. Here's what you'll need to do: Tap (i) at the bottom next to the Share icon. The shortcut's details will open. Toggle on "Show in Share Sheet". The switch will turn green. Tap Done twice. You can now find this shortcut in the Share menu. Now, you're ready to use the shortcut to combine photos.

steps.title: Open a photo in the Photos app and tap the Share button.
steps.content: Open a photo in the Photos app and tap the Share button.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap your new shortcut.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap your new shortcut. This should be near the bottom of the Share menu. A new window will open with your Camera Roll.

steps.title: Select photos you want to combine and tap Add.
steps.content: Select photos you want to combine and tap Add . Be sure to select photos in the order you want them to appear, starting from left to right. Once you tap Add , the combined image will be created. You can find it in your Camera Roll.

steps.title: Create a new album in the Photos app.
steps.content: Create a new album in the Photos app. When you open Photos, tap the + icon in the top-left corner and select New Album . Enter a name, and then tap Save . To create a grid collage directly on your iPhone, you can add photos to an album, resize the image sizes, and then take a screenshot . Your iPhone arranges the photos in a photo grid, making the perfect collage.

steps.title: Add the photos you want in your collage.
steps.content: Add the photos you want in your collage. Tap multiple photos to select them. Once you have your selected photos, tap Add or Done in the top-right corner. For best results, select 9 photos for a typical 3x3 grid collage.

steps.title: Tap the new album.
steps.content: Tap the new album. This will open the album in full.

steps.title: Resize the photos.
steps.content: Resize the photos. If the album doesn't already show the nine photos in a 3x3 grid, tap ••• in the top-right corner and select Zoom In or Zoom Out . If the pictures are all different sizes, you can change the thumbnail to fill in the square. Tap ••• in the top-right corner and select Square Photo Grid .

steps.title: Take a screenshot.
steps.content: Take a screenshot. On iPhones without a home button, press the top volume button and side button at the same time. On iPhones with a home button, press the home button and side button at the same time. [2] X Research source You'll see a preview of the screenshot in the bottom corner.

steps.title: Resize the screenshot.
steps.content: Resize the screenshot. Tap the screenshot preview to open it in full view. Drag the top and bottom of the screenshot to make sure it's only selecting the collage.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This is in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Save to Photos.
steps.content: Tap Save to Photos . This will save the collage to your Camera Roll. You can now upload it to other websites, such as Facebook and Instagram .

steps.title: Open a photo in the Photos app.
steps.content: Open a photo in the Photos app. If you want your photos to be blended together rather than in grids, you can use the sticker feature as a workaround. This involves turning objects in other photos into stickers and then pasting them onto a main photo.

steps.title: Tap and hold an object in the photo.
steps.content: Tap and hold an object in the photo. The object should be outlined in white, and a pop-up menu will open. If the menu doesn't open, lift your finger, and then tap and hold again. If it still doesn't work, you'll need to use a photo with a more distinct subject and background separation.

steps.title: Tap Add Sticker.
steps.content: Tap Add Sticker . This will add the subject as a sticker to your collection. Repeat steps 1-3 for all additional photos.

steps.title: Open a new photo in the Photos app.
steps.content: Open a new photo in the Photos app. This photo will act as your base layer.

steps.title: Tap the edit icon.
steps.content: Tap the edit icon. This looks like three sliders stacked horizontally at the bottom of the screen. On older versions of iOS, tap the photo, and then tap Edit in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap the pen icon.
steps.content: Tap the pen icon. This will open the Markup menu.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . You can find this at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Add Sticker.
steps.content: Tap Add Sticker . This is the first option.

steps.title: Select a sticker to add.
steps.content: Select a sticker to add. If you don't see your newly added stickers, tap the < arrow icon, and select the icon with the slightly-folded circle. When you tap a sticker, it will overlay on top of the base photo.

steps.title: Edit the sticker.
steps.content: Edit the sticker. Tap and hold the sticker to move its position. To make it bigger, drag one of the corner circles outwards. To make it smaller, drag one of the corner circles inwards. Tap ••• next to the sticker to Cut , Copy , Duplicate , or Delete it.

steps.title: Tap +, then Add Sticker to add more stickers.
steps.content: Tap + , then Add Sticker to add more stickers. Edit the stickers as needed.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will save the Markup edits.

steps.title: Tap Done again.
steps.content: Tap Done again. This will save the collage.

steps.title: You can compile and share memories.
steps.content: You can compile and share memories. If you have a special event, such as a birthday or wedding, you can create a collage of photos from that event. Rather than a photo album you need to flip through, you can see multiple moments side-by-side when it's placed in a collage.

steps.title: You can use collages to tell a story.
steps.content: You can use collages to tell a story. Collages can be used for other events—not just your own. You can use a collage to describe something that happened in the past, relate issues from different time periods, or even create links between two seemingly opposite things.

steps.title: Collages can be used as an outlet.
steps.content: Collages can be used as an outlet. Whether or not you're a naturally creative person, you can create collages to express any feelings you're holding inside. Collages can be created from anything; you don't need to use photos of people. Use photos of flowers, plants, scenery, and more.

steps.title: Collages can promote your products.
steps.content: Collages can promote your products. If you're a store owner or you sell a product, collages can help increase your sales. You can showcase the product in multiple perspectives, surround it by other similar products, and more to quickly show potential customers about your product.

steps.title: Collages can create memorable presentations.
steps.content: Collages can create memorable presentations. If you work in a field that relies on visuals to illustrate key points, collages can highlight important information.
